Dear Ms. Sepolen:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/3/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the
following information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
One of five new employee files did not have three references documented.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(2) The borrowing agency is responsible for securing
the items identified in subrules (1) (d), (e), (g), (h), and
(i) of this rule annually for the duration of the child’s
placement.
One of three borrowed bed files did not have a Foster Parent Agency Agreement
signed for 2022.

FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables…
At least three business days prior to a planned change
of placement or no later than three business days after
an unplanned placement change.
One of three foster care files did not have an FTM completed within the required
timeframe before a youth moved.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Medical Passports must be updated quarterly and uploaded/saved, even if they
are not required to be sent to anyone at that time. Be sure to date these Medical
Passports as a date is not auto generated when the passport is created.
• Orientation checklist for adoption applicants did not clearly outline that training
requirements are discussed with attendees. The agency updated this orientation
checklist during the review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Not requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
• The 5/22/2022 interim inspection resulted in fourteen rule and contract
violations. A CAP was approved on 6/28/22. At this time the agency
reports successful implementation of the CAP. This is evident, by the
fact the 2023 review determined zero repeat violations.
• On 6/27/2022 a special evaluation was initiated as it was reported the
agency did not send closed adoption files to the local DHHS offices
within the required timeframe. Policy ADM 1030 was cited and a CAP
approved on 7/18/22. The agency has implemented a new procedure for
tracking closed adoption files. At this time there have been no further
concerns in this area.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The agency reported some staffing changes over the past year, which were
challenging at the time, but have resulted in some positive changes and excellent
new staff. Chief Administrator stated the agency has been focused on CAP
compliance from the 2022 review. Overall, Chief Administrator believes CAP
implementation has been beneficial to the team and shown positive results.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews determined high satisfaction with supervisors, administrators, and
the organization overall. Staff stated they feel supported, recognized, and are
encouraged to take care of themselves. None of the staff had any suggestions for
improvement within the organization.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a large building on the St. Vincent campus. The building
provides adequate secure storage for files, staff offices, and visitation space for
children and families. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
